title: How to learn to write in a straight line - Quora

response.answer_text: Practice. I wrote on blank A4 paper to practice the same (the whole page filled with writing). It took about 70 pages to get it down properly, though I saw a radical betterment already by the 20th (I managed so-and-so thereafter, but at the 70th page it was consistent). There are probably other ways to do the same, but essentially you have to develop the feel for it, and that takes practice. A shortcut, if you’d be willing, and if the pages aren’t too thick, is including a lined sheet behind it to help you out. I’m not sure how that’d work to help you become independently capable of writing on blank pages, but if you just want pages without lines, it’s a nice substitute. I hope this helps.
